data.name: Pineco
data.flavorText: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.

data.name: Forretress ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Exploding Energy
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 5 Basic Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. If you searched your deck in this way, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Maractus
data.flavorText: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They're jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Toedscool
data.flavorText: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.

attacks.name: Furious Kicks
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Toedscruel ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Protective Mycelium
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent's Pokémon done to all of your Pokémon that have Energy attached. (Existing effects are not removed. Damage is not an effect.)

attacks.name: Colony Rush
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached.

data.name: Espathra ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dazzling Gaze
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent's Active Pokémon cost Colorless more.

attacks.name: Psy Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

attacks.name: Blazing Destruction
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

data.name: Charmeleon
data.flavorText: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

abilities.name: Flare Veil
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon. (Damage is not an effect.)

data.name: Magmar
data.flavorText: These Pokémon's bodies are constantly burning. Magmar are feared as one of the causes behind fires.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Magmortar
data.flavorText: Living in the crater of a volcano has caused this Pokémon's body to resemble its environment— it has an organ similar to a magma chamber.

attacks.name: Volcanic Heat
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Numel
data.flavorText: Magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. When it grows cold, the magma hardens and slows it.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Camerupt
data.flavorText: It lives in the crater of a volcano. It is well known that the humps on its back erupt every 10 years.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Cinder Cannon
attacks.text: You may discard a Fighting Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Heat Rotom
data.flavorText: If the convection microwave oven is not working properly, then the Rotom inhabiting it will become lethargic.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 40 damage to itself.

data.name: Charcadet
data.flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

data.name: Armarouge
data.flavorText: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.

abilities.name: Fire Off
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move a Fire Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flame Cannon
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.

attacks.name: Into the Deep
attacks.text: Put up to 3 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Freeze-Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Frigibax
data.flavorText: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: ﻿When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

abilities.name: Electrical Grounding
abilities.text: When 1 of your Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, you may move a Lightning Energy from that Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.

attacks.name: Shine On
attacks.text: Look at the top card of your deck. You may put that card on the bottom of your deck.

data.name: Lanturn
data.flavorText: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

attacks.name: Aqua Spark
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Kilowattrel
data.flavorText: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.

attacks.name: United Thunder
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the United Wings attack to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Exeggcute
data.flavorText: These Pokémon get nervous when they're not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Exeggutor
data.flavorText: When they work together, Exeggutor's three heads can put out powerful psychic energy. Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psychic Loop
attacks.text: Put 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Natu
data.flavorText: Because its wings aren't yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.

attacks.name: Triple Strike
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Xatu
data.flavorText: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun's movement all day.

abilities.name: Clairvoyant Sense
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic Psychic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, draw 2 cards.

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: The horns on its head provide a strong power that enables it to sense people's emotions.

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Gardevoir ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Embrace
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Basic Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Psychic Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon. You can't use this Ability on a Pokémon that would be Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Miracle Force
attacks.text: This Pokémon recovers from all Special Conditions.

data.name: Chimecho
data.flavorText: Emitting ultrasonic cries, it floats on winds to travel great distances.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot. The new Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Mime Jr.
data.flavorText: In an attempt to confuse its enemy, it mimics the enemy's movements. Then it wastes no time in making itself scarce!

attacks.name: Mimed Games
attacks.text: Your opponent chooses an attack from 1 of their Pokémon in play. Use the chosen attack as this attack.

data.name: Woobat
data.flavorText: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Swoobat
data.flavorText: The auspicious shape of this Pokémon's nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.

attacks.name: Attraction Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. Put 6 damage counters instead of 3 on that Pokémon for this Special Condition.

data.name: Cottonee
data.flavorText: Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that's highly prized by many luxury brands.

attacks.name: Fickle Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Whimsicott
data.flavorText: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.

data.name: Dedenne
data.flavorText: It's small and its electricity-generating organ is not fully developed, so it uses its tail to absorb electricity from people's homes and charge itself.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Spin Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Mimikyu
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon ex and Pokémon V.

attacks.name: Ghost Eye
attacks.text: Put 7 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Fidough
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough's breath induces fermentation in the Pokémon's vicinity.

data.name: Dachsbun
data.flavorText: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon's body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.

abilities.name: Well-Baked Body
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't be Burned. Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Fire Pokémon.

data.name: Ceruledge
data.flavorText: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.

attacks.name: Life Sucker
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fighting Sword
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex or Pokémon V, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Flittle
data.flavorText: Flittle's toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon's belly.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Greavard
data.flavorText: This friendly Pokémon doesn't like being alone. Pay it even the slightest bit of attention, and it will follow you forever.

attacks.name: Graveyard Gamboling
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each Psychic Pokémon in your discard pile.

data.name: Houndstone
data.flavorText: A lovingly mourned Pokémon was reborn as Houndstone. It doesn't like anyone touching the protuberance atop its head.

attacks.name: Last Respects
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Psychic Pokémon in your discard pile.

data.name: Gimmighoul
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.

attacks.name: Chest-ouflage
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Mankey
data.flavorText: It is extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next instant.

attacks.name: Monkey Beatdown
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Primeape
data.flavorText: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.

attacks.name: Raging Punch
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Annihilape
data.flavorText: It imbues its fists with the power of the rage that it kept hidden in its heart. Opponents struck by these imbued fists will be shattered to their core.

attacks.name: Rage Fist
attacks.text: This attack does 70 damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

attacks.name: Dynamite Punch
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Phanpy
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives and nests on a riverbank. After playing in the mud, it won't be able to settle down unless it washes its body.

data.name: Donphan
data.flavorText: Donphan is covered in tough hide, so even being hit by a car won't faze this Pokémon. However, it is extremely susceptible to rain.

attacks.name: Cragalanche
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Powerful Spin
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Barboach
data.flavorText: Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar. Even in muddy waters, it can detect its prey's location.

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Clobbopus
data.flavorText: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn't alarmed when that happens—it knows they'll grow back. It's about as smart as a three-year-old.

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Grapploct
data.flavorText: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.

attacks.name: Slow-Acting Syncope
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon will be Knocked Out.

data.name: Great Tusk ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Quaking Demolition
abilities.text: Once at the end of your turn (after your attack), if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you must discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Great Bash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Charizard ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Infernal Reign
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Basic Fire Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Burning Darkness
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

attacks.name: Allure
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Haunter
data.flavorText: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

attacks.name: Dark Slumber
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Gengar
data.flavorText: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.

abilities.name: Night Gate
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Paldean Wooper
data.flavorText: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.

attacks.name: Find a Home
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Paldean Clodsire ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Toxic Wetland
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if a Stadium is in play, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Poisoned.

attacks.name: Needle Bone
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Scraggy
data.flavorText: It protects itself with its durable skin. It's thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.

data.name: Scrafty
data.flavorText: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.

attacks.name: Lambaste
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Maschiff
data.flavorText: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff's face.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Mabosstiff
data.flavorText: Mabosstiff loves playing with children. Though usually gentle, it takes on an intimidating look when protecting its family.

abilities.name: Intimidating Howl
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Varoom
data.flavorText: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.

attacks.name: Rev
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Revavroom
data.flavorText: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders— now numbering eight—to generate energy.

abilities.name: Rumbling Engine
abilities.text: You must discard an Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Iron Treads ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Iron-Clad Roll
attacks.text: After doing damage, you may discard all Future Booster Energy Capsules from this Pokémon. If you do, during your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 150 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Gholdengo
data.flavorText: Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokémon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.

attacks.name: Lavish Hospitality
attacks.text: You may attach any number of Basic Metal Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Scintillating Surfing
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

data.name: Noibat
data.flavorText: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from its large ears to search for fruit to eat. It mistakes Applin for its food.

data.name: Noivern ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Covert Flight
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dominating Echo
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Special Energy or Stadium cards from their hand.

data.name: Cyclizar
data.flavorText: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.

attacks.name: Acceleration Drive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Lechonk
data.flavorText: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn't use it for anything other than foraging.

attacks.name: Whimsy Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Oinkologne
data.flavorText: This Pokémon sends a flowerlike scent wafting about. Well-developed muscles in its legs allow it to leap more than 16 feet with no trouble at all.

attacks.name: Finest Selection
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. Put a number of cards up to the number of heads from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Perfume Press
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Tandemaus
data.flavorText: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.name: Maushold
data.flavorText: The larger pair protects the little ones during battles. When facing strong opponents, the whole group will join the fight.

attacks.name: Family Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 70 damage for each of your Maushold in play.

data.name: Squawkabilly ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Squawk and Seize
abilities.text: Once during your first turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Squawk and Seize Ability during your turn.

attacks.name: Motivate
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Artazon
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may search their deck for a Basic Pokémon that doesn't have a Rule Box and put it onto their Bench. Then, that player shuffles their deck. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.)
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

data.name: Atticus
rules: You can use this card only if your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned.
Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Clive
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you draw 2 cards for each Supporter card you find there.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Electric Generator
rules: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck and attach up to 2 Basic Lightning Energy cards you find there to your Benched Lightning Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Iono
rules: Each player shuffles their hand and puts it on the bottom of their deck. If either player put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, each player draws a card for each of their remaining Prize cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Moonlit Hill
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a Basic Psychic Energy card from their hand in order to heal 30 damage from each of their Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

data.name: Nemona
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Nemona's Backpack
rules: Put up to 2 Nemona cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Nest Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Paldean Student
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon that doesn't have a Rule Box, reveal it, and put it into your hand. For each Paldean Student card (not including this card) in your discard pile, you may search for an additional Pokémon in this way. Then, shuffle your deck. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Paldean Student
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon that doesn't have a Rule Box, reveal it, and put it into your hand. For each Paldean Student card (not including this card) in your discard pile, you may search for an additional Pokémon in this way. Then, shuffle your deck. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Professor's Research
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Professor's Research
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it, skipping the Stage 1. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Technical Machine: Crisis Punch
rules: The Pokémon this card is attached to can use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.) If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your turn.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

attacks.name: Crisis Punch
attacks.text: You can use this attack only when your opponent has exactly 1 Prize card remaining.

data.name: Ultra Ball
rules: You can use this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

data.name: Gloom
data.flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

abilities.name: Semi-Blooming Energy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.name: Vileplume
data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

abilities.name: Fully Blooming Energy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 8 cards of your deck and attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Hoppip
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is blown across vast distances by the wind. It is unclear where the Hoppip of Paldea originally came from.

attacks.name: Splashing Dodge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Skiploom
data.flavorText: Skiploom enthusiasts can apparently tell where a Skiploom was born by the scent drifting from the flower on the Pokémon's head.

abilities.name: Drifting Dodge
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

attacks.name: Flowery Zephyr
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Jumpluff
data.flavorText: Jumpluff travels on seasonal winds. Once its cotton spores run out, its journey ends, as does its life.

abilities.name: Drifting Dodge
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

attacks.name: Fluffy Breeze
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Pineco
data.flavorText: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.

data.name: Snover
data.flavorText: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.

data.name: Abomasnow
data.flavorText: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

abilities.name: Freezing Disaster
abilities.text: Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) can't be healed.

data.name: Smoliv
data.flavorText: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.

attacks.name: Nutrients
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Dolliv
data.flavorText: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.

attacks.name: Apply Oil
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.name: Arboliva
data.flavorText: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.

abilities.name: Enriching Oil
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Toedscool
data.flavorText: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.

attacks.name: Furious Kicks
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Capsakid
data.flavorText: Traditional Paldean dishes can be extremely spicy because they include the shed front teeth of Capsakid among their ingredients.

attacks.name: Increasing Spice
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Scovillain
data.flavorText: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Grass and Fire type.

attacks.name: Spicy Headbutt
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Rellor
data.flavorText: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.

attacks.name: Ball Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

attacks.name: Blazing Destruction
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

data.name: Charmeleon
data.flavorText: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

abilities.name: Flare Veil
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon. (Damage is not an effect.)

data.name: Paldean Tauros
data.flavorText: People call this kind of Tauros the Blaze Breed due to the hot air it snorts from its nostrils. Its three tails are intertwined.

attacks.name: Raging Horns
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blaze Dash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Entei
data.flavorText: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent's Active Pokémon do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Blaze Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Oricorio
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is incredibly popular, possibly because its passionate dancing is a great match with the temperament of Paldean people.

abilities.name: Ardent Dancing
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from your Active Evolution Pokémon.

data.name: Charcadet
data.flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

data.name: Armarouge
data.flavorText: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.

abilities.name: Fire Off
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move a Fire Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flame Cannon
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Slowpoke
data.flavorText: It is always vacantly lost in thought, but no one knows what it is thinking about. It is good at fishing with its tail.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep. Heal 30 damage from it.

data.name: Slowbro
data.flavorText: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, this Pokémon reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke.

abilities.name: Strange Behavior
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Staryu
data.flavorText: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn't bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Starmie
data.flavorText: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.

abilities.name: Mysterious Comet
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you placed any damage counters in this way, discard this Pokémon and all attached cards.

data.name: Paldean Tauros
data.flavorText: It swims by jetting water from its horns. The most notable characteristic of the Aqua Breed is its high body fat, which allows it to float easily.

attacks.name: Raging Horns
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Wiglett
data.flavorText: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.

attacks.name: Twisting Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Wugtrio
data.flavorText: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.

attacks.name: Undersea Tunnel
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Finizen
data.flavorText: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.

attacks.name: Valiant Evolution
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Palafin
data.flavorText: This Pokémon's ancient genes have awakened. It is now so extraordinarily strong that it can easily lift a cruise ship with one fin.

attacks.name: Jet Punch
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Justice Kick
attacks.text: If this Pokémon didn't move from the Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Veluza
data.flavorText: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.

attacks.name: Slim Screw
attacks.text: If you have no cards in your hand, this attack can be used for Water.

data.name: Dondozo
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it's bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.

attacks.name: Release Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Tatsugiri in your discard pile.

data.name: Tatsugiri
data.flavorText: This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.

attacks.name: Mise en Place
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Basic Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Curl Up
attacks.text: Put this Pokémon and all attached cards into your hand.

data.name: Frigibax
data.flavorText: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Arctibax
data.flavorText: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.

data.name: Baxcalibur
data.flavorText: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.

abilities.name: Super Cold
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Basic Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: ﻿When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

abilities.name: Electrical Grounding
abilities.text: When 1 of your Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, you may move a Lightning Energy from that Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Electrode
data.flavorText: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.

attacks.name: Bang Boom Chain
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may discard any number of Pokémon Tools from your Pokémon. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Shinx
data.flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

attacks.name: Wild Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Luxio
data.flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

data.name: Luxray
data.flavorText: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.

abilities.name: Swelling Flash
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in your hand and you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, you may put this Pokémon onto your Bench.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Pachirisu
data.flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

abilities.name: Electricity Pouches
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't be Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Everyone Discharge
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your Benched Lightning Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness.

data.name: Thundurus
data.flavorText: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

abilities.name: Adverse Weather
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gigantic Bolt
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 90 damage to itself.

data.name: Toxel
data.flavorText: It has no problem drinking dirty water. An organ inside Toxel's body filters such water into a poisonous liquid that is harmless to Toxel.

attacks.name: Slight Intrusion
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Toxtricity
data.flavorText: Many youths admire the way this Pokémon listlessly picks fights and keeps its cool no matter what opponent it faces.

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Loud Mix
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each different type of Pokémon on your Bench.

data.name: Pawmi
data.flavorText: The pads of its paws are electricity-discharging organs. Pawmi fires electricity from its forepaws while standing unsteadily on its hind legs.

data.name: Pawmo
data.flavorText: Pawmo uses a unique fighting technique in which it uses its forepaws to strike foes and zap them with electricity from its paw pads simultaneously.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Pawmot
data.flavorText: Pawmot's fluffy fur acts as a battery. It can store the same amount of electricity as an electric car.

abilities.name: Electrogenesis
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Basic Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Electro Paws
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Wattrel
data.flavorText: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.

attacks.name: United Wings
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the United Wings attack.

data.name: Kilowattrel
data.flavorText: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.

attacks.name: United Thunder
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the United Wings attack to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Wigglytuff
data.flavorText: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.

abilities.name: Balloon Therapy
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Therapeutic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Abra
data.flavorText: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.

data.name: Kadabra
data.flavorText: This Pokémon's telekinesis is immensely powerful. To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up psychic energy in the star on its forehead.

attacks.name: Teleportation Attack
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Cleffa
data.flavorText: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

attacks.name: Grasping Draw
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

data.name: Natu
data.flavorText: Because its wings aren't yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.

attacks.name: Triple Strike
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Xatu
data.flavorText: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun's movement all day.

abilities.name: Clairvoyant Sense
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic Psychic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, draw 2 cards.

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: The horns on its head provide a strong power that enables it to sense people's emotions.

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Drifloon
data.flavorText: It is whispered that any child who mistakes Drifloon for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.

attacks.name: Balloon Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Drifblim
data.flavorText: It can generate and release gas within its body. That's how it can control the altitude of its drift.

attacks.name: Curse Spreading
attacks.text: Put 8 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Mime Jr.
data.flavorText: In an attempt to confuse its enemy, it mimics the enemy's movements. Then it wastes no time in making itself scarce!

attacks.name: Mimed Games
attacks.text: Your opponent chooses an attack from 1 of their Pokémon in play. Use the chosen attack as this attack.

data.name: Spiritomb
data.flavorText: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.

abilities.name: Fettered in Misfortune
abilities.text: Basic Pokémon V in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.

attacks.name: Fade Out
attacks.text: Put this Pokémon and all attached cards into your hand.

data.name: Klefki
data.flavorText: In the past, noble families entrusted their vault keys to a Klefki. They passed the Klefki down through the generations, taking good care of it.

abilities.name: Mischievous Lock
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, Basic Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities, except for Mischievous Lock.

attacks.name: Joust
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Mimikyu
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon ex and Pokémon V.

attacks.name: Ghost Eye
attacks.text: Put 7 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Dachsbun
data.flavorText: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon's body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.

abilities.name: Well-Baked Body
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't be Burned. Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Fire Pokémon.

data.name: Ceruledge
data.flavorText: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.

attacks.name: Life Sucker
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fighting Sword
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex or Pokémon V, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Rabsca
data.flavorText: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.

attacks.name: Revival Blessing
attacks.text: Put a Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Flittle
data.flavorText: Flittle's toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon's belly.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Tinkatink
data.flavorText: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.

attacks.name: Scrap Pickup
attacks.text: Put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Tinkatuff
data.flavorText: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Pulverizing Press
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Tinkaton
data.flavorText: This intelligent Pokémon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.

abilities.name: Gather Materials
abilities.text: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Special Hammer
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Houndstone
data.flavorText: A lovingly mourned Pokémon was reborn as Houndstone. It doesn't like anyone touching the protuberance atop its head.

attacks.name: Last Respects
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Psychic Pokémon in your discard pile.

data.name: Mankey
data.flavorText: It is extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next instant.

attacks.name: Monkey Beatdown
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Primeape
data.flavorText: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.

attacks.name: Raging Punch
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Annihilape
data.flavorText: It imbues its fists with the power of the rage that it kept hidden in its heart. Opponents struck by these imbued fists will be shattered to their core.

attacks.name: Rage Fist
attacks.text: This attack does 70 damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

attacks.name: Dynamite Punch
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Paldean Tauros
data.flavorText: This kind of Tauros, known as the Combat Breed, is distinguished by its thick, powerful muscles and its fierce disposition.

attacks.name: Raging Horns
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Combat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Lucario
data.flavorText: It's said that no foe can remain invisible to Lucario, since it can detect auras—even those of foes it could not otherwise see.

attacks.name: Avenging Knuckle
attacks.text: If any of your Fighting Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

attacks.name: Accelerating Stab
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Accelerating Stab.

data.name: Hawlucha
data.flavorText: Its elegant finishing moves—performed by nimbly leaping around using its wings—are polished in the forest where it was born and raised.

abilities.name: Flying Entry
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and put 1 damage counter on each of them.

data.name: Nacli
data.flavorText: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.

attacks.name: Salt Coating
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Naclstack
data.flavorText: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey's body.

attacks.name: Salt Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

data.name: Garganacl
data.flavorText: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.

abilities.name: Blessed Salt
abilities.text: During Pokémon Checkup, heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Knocking Hammer
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Glimmet
data.flavorText: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Paldean Wooper
data.flavorText: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.

attacks.name: Find a Home
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Murkrow
data.flavorText: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

attacks.name: Spin Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: United Wings
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the United Wings attack.

data.name: Sneasel
data.flavorText: This cunning Pokémon hides under the cover of darkness, waiting to attack its prey.

data.name: Weavile
data.flavorText: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.

abilities.name: Assaulting Hunt
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to the Active Spot, you may switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon to the Active Spot.

data.name: Sableye
data.flavorText: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.

attacks.name: Night Eyes
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Unseen Claw
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: Pawniard will fearlessly challenge even powerful foes. In a pinch, it will cling to opponents and pierce them with the blades all over its body.

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: This Pokémon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.

attacks.name: Double-Edged Slash
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Kingambit
data.flavorText: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.

abilities.name: Leadership
abilities.text: Your Basic Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Mabosstiff
data.flavorText: Mabosstiff loves playing with children. Though usually gentle, it takes on an intimidating look when protecting its family.

abilities.name: Intimidating Howl
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Shroodle
data.flavorText: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.

attacks.name: Berry Search
attacks.text: Put a Basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Grafaiai
data.flavorText: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Colorful Graffiti
attacks.text: You may discard as many Basic Energy cards as you like from your hand. This attack does 40 damage for each type of Basic Energy you discarded in this way.

data.name: Scizor
data.flavorText: This Pokémon's pincers, which contain steel, can crush any hard object they get ahold of into bits.

attacks.name: Punishing Scissors
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play that has an Ability.

data.name: Varoom
data.flavorText: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.

attacks.name: Rev
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Revavroom
data.flavorText: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders— now numbering eight—to generate energy.

abilities.name: Rumbling Engine
abilities.text: You must discard an Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Noibat
data.flavorText: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from its large ears to search for fruit to eat. It mistakes Applin for its food.

data.name: Cyclizar
data.flavorText: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.

attacks.name: Acceleration Drive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Pidgey
data.flavorText: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Pidgeotto
data.flavorText: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

data.name: Jigglypuff
data.flavorText: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Stompy Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Doduo
data.flavorText: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Dodrio
data.flavorText: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.

abilities.name: Zooming Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put 1 damage counter on this Pokémon. If you do, draw a card.

attacks.name: Ballistic Beak
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Ditto
data.flavorText: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can't maintain its disguise.

abilities.name: Transformative Start
abilities.text: Once during your first turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may search your deck and choose a Basic Pokémon you find there, except any Ditto. If you do, discard this Pokémon and all attached cards, and put the chosen Pokémon in its place. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: This Pokémon's stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.

abilities.name: Voraciousness
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put up to 2 Leftovers cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Thudding Press
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Wingull
data.flavorText: It soars high in the sky, riding on updrafts like a glider. It carries food tucked in its bill.

data.name: Pelipper
data.flavorText: It is a flying transporter that carries small Pokémon in its beak. It bobs on the waves to rest its wings.

abilities.name: Hearsay
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may choose 1: put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand; or search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, put it into your hand, and then shuffle your deck.

data.name: Skwovet
data.flavorText: No matter how much it stuffs its belly with food, it is always anxious about getting hungry again. So, it stashes berries in its cheeks and tail.

abilities.name: Nest Stash
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may shuffle your hand and put it on the bottom of your deck. If you put any cards on the bottom of your deck in this way, draw a card.

data.name: Greedent
data.flavorText: This Pokémon makes off with heaps of fallen berries by wrapping them in its tail, which is roughly twice the length of its body.

attacks.name: Enhanced Fang
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Lechonk
data.flavorText: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn't use it for anything other than foraging.

attacks.name: Whimsy Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Oinkologne
data.flavorText: This Pokémon sends a flowerlike scent wafting about. Well-developed muscles in its legs allow it to leap more than 16 feet with no trouble at all.

attacks.name: Finest Selection
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. Put a number of cards up to the number of heads from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Perfume Press
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Tandemaus
data.flavorText: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.name: Maushold
data.flavorText: The larger pair protects the little ones during battles. When facing strong opponents, the whole group will join the fight.

attacks.name: Family Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 70 damage for each of your Maushold in play.

data.name: Flamigo
data.flavorText: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.

abilities.name: Insta-Flock
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Flamigo, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: United Wings
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the United Wings attack.

data.name: Forretress ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Exploding Energy
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 5 Basic Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. If you searched your deck in this way, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Toedscruel ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Protective Mycelium
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent's Pokémon done to all of your Pokémon that have Energy attached. (Existing effects are not removed. Damage is not an effect.)

attacks.name: Colony Rush
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached.

data.name: Espathra ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dazzling Gaze
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent's Active Pokémon cost Colorless more.

attacks.name: Psy Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

data.name: Alakazam ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mind Jack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dimensional Hand
attacks.text: This attack can be used even if this Pokémon is on the Bench.

data.name: Mew ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Restart
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Genome Hacking
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

data.name: Gardevoir ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Embrace
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Basic Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Psychic Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon. You can't use this Ability on a Pokémon that would be Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Miracle Force
attacks.text: This Pokémon recovers from all Special Conditions.

data.name: Glimmora ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dust Field
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can't have more than 3 Benched Pokémon. If they have 4 or more Benched Pokémon, they discard Benched Pokémon until they have 3 Pokémon on the Bench. If more than one effect changes the number of Benched Pokémon allowed, use the smaller number.

attacks.name: Poisonous Gem
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Paldean Clodsire ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Toxic Wetland
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if a Stadium is in play, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Poisoned.

attacks.name: Needle Bone
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Noivern ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Covert Flight
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dominating Echo
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Special Energy or Stadium cards from their hand.

data.name: Pidgeot ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Quick Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. You can't use more than 1 Quick Search Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Blustery Wind
attacks.text: You may discard a Stadium in play.

data.name: Wigglytuff ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Expanding Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, it gets +100 HP.

attacks.name: Friend Tackle
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Squawkabilly ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Squawk and Seize
abilities.text: Once during your first turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Squawk and Seize Ability during your turn.

attacks.name: Motivate
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Wugtrio
data.flavorText: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.

attacks.name: Undersea Tunnel
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Palafin
data.flavorText: This Pokémon's ancient genes have awakened. It is now so extraordinarily strong that it can easily lift a cruise ship with one fin.

attacks.name: Jet Punch
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Justice Kick
attacks.text: If this Pokémon didn't move from the Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Pawmi
data.flavorText: The pads of its paws are electricity-discharging organs. Pawmi fires electricity from its forepaws while standing unsteadily on its hind legs.

data.name: Clive
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you draw 2 cards for each Supporter card you find there.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Judge
rules: Each player shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Nemona
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Paldean Student
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon that doesn't have a Rule Box, reveal it, and put it into your hand. For each Paldean Student card (not including this card) in your discard pile, you may search for an additional Pokémon in this way. Then, shuffle your deck. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Paldean Student
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon that doesn't have a Rule Box, reveal it, and put it into your hand. For each Paldean Student card (not including this card) in your discard pile, you may search for an additional Pokémon in this way. Then, shuffle your deck. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Restart
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Genome Hacking
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

data.name: Gardevoir ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Embrace
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Basic Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Psychic Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon. You can't use this Ability on a Pokémon that would be Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Miracle Force
attacks.text: This Pokémon recovers from all Special Conditions.

data.name: Charizard ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Infernal Reign
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Basic Fire Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Burning Darkness
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

data.name: Arven
rules: Search your deck for an Item card and a Pokémon Tool card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Clive
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you draw 2 cards for each Supporter card you find there.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Iono
rules: Each player shuffles their hand and puts it on the bottom of their deck. If either player put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, each player draws a card for each of their remaining Prize cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Nemona
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Penny
rules: Put 1 of your Basic Pokémon and all attached cards into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Wo-Chien ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Covetous Ivy
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon for each Prize card your opponent has taken. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Chi-Yu ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jealously Singe
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Flame Surge
attacks.text: Choose up to 3 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Basic Fire Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Chien-Pao ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shivery Chill
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may search your deck for up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Hail Blade
attacks.text: You may discard any amount of Water Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Miraidon ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Tandem Unit
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Basic Lightning Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Photon Blaster
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Ting-Lu ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Cursed Land
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Pokémon in play that have any damage counters on them have no Abilities, except for Pokémon ex.

attacks.name: Land Scoop
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Koraidon ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dino Cry
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach up to 2 Basic Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to your Basic Fighting Pokémon in any way you like. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Wild Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.
